The only valid use of tariffs is when a foreign supplier is trying to undercut a domestic producer by dumping goods at below cost in an effort to force the domestic producer into a price war or bankruptcy.  The fact is consumers benefit from Free Trade: the efficient use of comparative advantage, global competition and efficient world wide supply chains.    There is this quixotic desire use tariffs to 'bring back manufacturing'.  Which seems to be fueled by this idea that it will translate into jobs.  There are several flaws in this line of reasoning.  1. If your tariff regime results in reciprocal tariffs (duh), then there is no international market for the goods you produce.
